name: The Ultimate American Presidents Quiz |   U.S. Government

questions.text: Up until 2012, how many US presidents shared the same first name of George?
questions.explanation:
3.

	George Washington, George Bush and George W. Bush.

questions.text: James Monroe was US president before James Madison. True or false?
questions.explanation:
False.

	Madison was the 4th and Monroe the 5th.

questions.text: In what year was the oath of the president first administered in the USA?
Up until 2012, how many times have two US presidents shared a last name (exclude Cleveland)?
questions.explanation:
5.

	Adams, Harrison, Johnson, Roosevelt and Bush.

questions.text: Up until 2012, how many US presidents are there with first names starting with the letter 'J' (NOT counting John Calvin Coolidge)?
How many states in the USA have yielded one or more presidents as of 2010?
Who was US president in between Grover Cleveland's two terms?
Which of the following was, at the time of his election, the youngest person to be ELECTED to the role of President of the USA?
questions.explanation:
John F. Kennedy

	The youngest person to become President was Theodore Roosevelt, who was the 42-year old Vice-President when he took on the role following the assassination of William McKinley. But John F. Kennedy was the youngest elected to the role, aged 43.

questions.text: Who was the 12th president of the USA?
Warren G. Harding was US president before Herbert C. Hoover. True or false?
questions.explanation:
True.

	Harding was the 29th president and Hoover was 31st.

questions.text: As at 2012, how many US presidents have shared the same first name of James?
questions.explanation:
6.

	Madison, Monroe, K. Polk, Buchanan, A. Garfield and Carter.

questions.text: Who was the 33rd president of the USA?
Jimmy Carter was US President immediately before whom?
As at 2012, how many US presidents' first name and last name both start with the same letter?
questions.explanation:
2.

	Herbert C. Hoover and Ronald Reagan. Calvin Coolidge's first name was John, so he doesn't count. Nor does Woodrow Wilson, whose first name was Thomas.

questions.text: In what year did Abraham Lincoln address Gettysburg?
